history.text: Do you like movies of fantasy and drama?
Not particularly. This movie really would not catch my interest. It has a very unusual plot line.
Do you agree with the rating of the movie?
No. There was even a critic who wrote that this movie is not ground breaking. So I dont see how it could receive such a high rating.

It is the same story line as every other movie out there. A girl falls in love with an unlikely boy. This boy happens to be a weird creature and she's deaf. The deaf girl is probably the only interesting aspect to me. The rest of it is just whatever for me. Is this something you would see?
I liked del Toro's work because it was elegant and creative
It also had a great critical review
It may have a great director but if the plot line is mundane, it wont make it as an all time classic movie
Do you generally watch movies with good ratings?
I would say so. Doesn't always mean I agree with the ratings.
In the first key scene, I would be drawn into the story. I like knowing her backstory that she was found in the river with wounds on her neck and now has to communicate through sign language.
I liked Sally Hawkins performance being mute
Why did you enjoy her performance?
I enjoyed her performance as mentally handicapped
Benicio del Toro is a great director

I dont think she was mentally handicapped. She just wasn't able to speak - assuming it was because of when she was little and had whatever freak accident. This movie is multifaceted with lots of different dimensions.
She has sex with a river creature in her bathroom
He also eats one of her cats. That would be a deal breaker for me.
I don't think that scene in the movie added to anything and probably could have gone without it.
It shows how the creature can heal when he slashes Gile's arm
Elisa had to go and find him and bring him back to the apartment.
And then the bathroom gets completely filled with water
Strickland tortures Mosenenkov for information. That would be intense.
Yes but the creature slashes his throat in the end and kills him
Zelda's husband is the one who told on Elisa and the creature. He was afraid though because Strickland was yelling at his wife.
Stickland knew where she was through her calendar note. That was a bad move on her part to write it in her calendar.

I think it is interesting that when he heals Elisa, she can start to breathe through gills. The creatures touch was able to completely change her DNA makeup and give her something she normally would have never been able to have.
Through narration, Giles conveys his belief that Elisa lived "happily ever after" with the creature. I hope this is true.

uid1response.feedback: I had no idea what I was supposed to say. The document didn't have enough opinion, only information about the plot
